text.headline:
Poitiers
(2016 - 2019)
text.text: <txt id='main'>My journey begins in Poitiers, my home town. This is the location of the high school where I studied. I took an ES baccalauréat, i.e. a program focusing on the social sciences (economics, sociology, geography, history...). I passed the exam with distinction "very good".</txt>

text.headline:
La Rochelle
(2019 - 2022)
text.text: My student life then began in La Rochelle, by the ocean. There I took a degree in geography and planning, which I passed with honors.I really enjoyed these three years. They confirmed my taste for geography as a powerful discipline for understanding the world from a wide variety of angles.

text.headline:
Zadar
(2022)
text.text: <txt id='main'>During the last semester of my bachelor's degree, I took part in an Erasmus mobility program in Zadar, Croatia. It was an extraordinary experience that gave me language skills, independence and lots of wonderful memories.</txt>

text.headline:
Rennes
(2022 - 2024)
text.text: Back in France, I started a Master's degree in Rennes. I took the SIGAT master's degree, a course dedicated to geomatics. I graduated top of my class. I really like geomatics, as it enables to produce concrete spatial decision-making tools.

text.headline:
Champs-sur-Marne
(2024)
text.text: From May to October, I did my final year internship at Champs-sur-Marne. As part of an IGN (i.e french national mapping agency) research team, I was involved in the development and valuation of CartAGen, a mapping tool. This internship gave me solid experience in Python programming, and encourages me to work in the field of research engineering.
